message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper is about acoustic modeling in speech recognition using deep bidirectional long short-term memory (BLSTM) recurrent neural networks. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which includes papers on natural language processing and speech recognition. The paper also discusses various optimization methods, batching, truncated backpropagation, and regularization techniques, which are related to machine learning and optimization, making cs.SD (Systems and Control) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) likely categories as well. Additionally, the paper introduces a pretraining scheme for LSTMs, which is a type of artificial neural network, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a possible category. Finally, the paper uses RETURNN and RASR, which are frameworks for universal recurrent neural networks and ASR toolkit, respectively, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible category as well.
